hero.headline: Linux Foundation Launches Agentic AI Foundation: OpenAI, Anthropic, Block Donate MCP, Goose, and AGENTS.md
hero.summary: The Linux Foundation has launched the Agentic AI Foundation (AAIF) with unprecedented industry backing. Anthropic is donating MCP (Model Context Protocol), Block contributes Goose (their internal agent framework used by thousands of engineers), and OpenAI provides AGENTS.md (now adopted by 60,000+ open-source projects). AWS, Bloomberg, Cloudflare, Google, and Microsoft joined at launch.
hero.whyItMatters: This is the most significant standardization effort in AI agent history. With MCP becoming vendor-neutral infrastructure, developers won't need endless one-off adapters between AI tools. The fact that OpenAI, Anthropic, and Block are collaborating rather than competing on infrastructure signals a mature industry prioritizing interoperability over lock-in.

topStories.title: GitHub Copilot Now Lets You Choose: Claude Opus 4.5, Claude Sonnet 4.5, or GPT-5.1-Codex-Max
topStories.summary: GitHub Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers can now select their preferred AI model for the coding agent. Choose between Auto, Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5, Claude Sonnet 4.5, or OpenAI GPT-5.1-Codex-Max. Business and Enterprise tiers coming soon.

topStories.title: Amazon Unveils Kiro: An Autonomous Coding Agent That Works for Days
topStories.summary: AWS previewed Kiro, a 'frontier agent' that can work autonomously for days on complex coding tasks. It learns team workflows by analyzing existing code, maintains persistent context across sessions, and handles large-scale updates across dependent systems. Also announced: AWS Security Agent and DevOps Agent.

topStories.title: Chrome DevTools MCP Server Trending: Browser Debugging for AI Agents
topStories.summary: Google's official Chrome DevTools MCP server is gaining traction on GitHub. It enables AI coding agents to interact with Chrome's debugging capabilities, opening new possibilities for automated testing, performance analysis, and browser automation workflows.

topStories.title: Theo Reviews Claude Code's Latest Update: 'Really Cool When It Works'
topStories.summary: Popular tech YouTuber Theo (t3.gg) published a 35-minute deep dive on Claude Code's newest features including asynchronous agents, named sessions, and the thinking mode now enabled by default for Opus 4.5. Honest take on both the power and current limitations.

trendingRepos.name: CopilotKit/CopilotKit
trendingRepos.description: React UI + elegant infrastructure for AI Copilots, chatbots, and in-app AI agents. The 'agentic last-mile' for building production AI assistants. 135 stars gained today.

trendingRepos.name: langgenius/dify
trendingRepos.description: Production-ready platform for agentic workflow development. Build, deploy, and manage AI agents with a visual interface. 217 stars gained today.

trendingRepos.name: simstudioai/sim
trendingRepos.description: Open-source platform to build and deploy AI agent workflows. Visual workflow builder for orchestrating multiple AI agents. 151 stars gained today.

trendingRepos.name: AmbitionCX/chrome-devtools-mcp
trendingRepos.description: Chrome DevTools for coding agents. Enable AI assistants to interact with browser debugging tools for testing and automation workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Multi-AI Code Review
trendingSkills.description: Orchestrate code reviews across Codex, Gemini, and Claude with automatic fallback. Get multiple AI perspectives on your code changes with one command.

trendingSkills.name: Jules API Delegation
trendingSkills.description: Delegate asynchronous coding tasks to Jules (Google's AI coding agent) to maximize efficiency. Work with multiple AI agents in parallel.

trendingSkills.name: AI Verification Reports
trendingSkills.description: Automated 3-AI verification result documentation and export workflow. Generate comprehensive reports from multi-model analysis sessions.

trendingSkills.name: Skill Creator Plus
trendingSkills.description: Enhanced guide for creating effective Claude Code skills with advanced patterns, validation, and marketplace publishing workflow.

newMcpServers.name: arxiv-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Bridge between AI assistants and arXiv research. Search papers with advanced filtering, download as markdown, and run deep research analysis. Perfect for literature reviews.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Enable AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters via kubectl. Manage deployments, pods, and services through natural language commands.

newMcpServers.name: apify-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Access Apify's marketplace of 1,800+ web scraping and automation tools. Extract data from social media, e-commerce, search engines, and any website.

newMcpServers.name: gmail-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Gmail operations via IMAP/SMTP with app password authentication. List messages, search emails, and send messages through AI assistants.

notableHooks.name: GitButler Auto-Branch
notableHooks.description: Automatically isolate AI-generated code changes into separate Git branches per Claude session. Uses PreToolUse and PostToolUse hooks with Edit|MultiEdit|Write matchers.

notableHooks.name: Session Environment Setup
notableHooks.description: SessionStart hooks can write to CLAUDE_ENV_FILE to set environment variables for all subsequent bash commands. Perfect for API keys, project configs, or build settings.

notableHooks.name: Desktop Notification on Stop
notableHooks.description: Send desktop notifications when Claude completes a session. Simple but powerful for long-running tasks - know immediately when your AI agent finishes work.

tuiTools.name: gum
tuiTools.description: A tool for glamorous shell scripts. Write beautiful, interactive command-line interfaces in bash with spinners, prompts, and styled output. From Charm.sh.

tuiTools.name: gitui
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal UI for Git written in Rust. Full git workflow support with keyboard-driven efficiency. Modern alternative to lazygit.

tuiTools.name: slides
tuiTools.description: Terminal-based presentation tool. Write slides in Markdown and present them beautifully in your terminal. Built with Bubbletea.

tuiTools.name: bottom
tuiTools.description: Customizable cross-platform graphical process/system monitor for the terminal. Beautiful charts and graphs for CPU, memory, network. Ratatui-powered.

trendingVideos.title: I'll never use n8n the same......
Claude Code's latest update is really cool (when it works...)
Verdent AI just made vibe coding devs unstoppable!
Google's Secret FREE Tool DESTROYS Paid AI Coders (Built 3 Apps in Minutes)

highlights: Thinking mode now enabled by default for Opus 4.5 - extended reasoning on every response
Switch models mid-prompt with alt+p (Linux/Windows) or option+p (macOS)
Fixed IME composition window positioning for CJK input methods
MCP Resources support for expanded capability integrations
Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite model support via gemini -m flag
Persistent 'Always Allow' policies with granular shell and MCP support
Remote compact for API-key users - enables compacting in key-based sessions
Cloud exec --branch for remote runs with status/diff/apply flows

notableQuotes.quote: Our goal is to make MCP the neutral infrastructure connecting AI models to tools, data, and applications without endless one-off adapters.
notableQuotes.author: David Soria Parra

notableQuotes.quote: You can assign a complex task from the backlog and Kiro independently figures out how to get that work done, working autonomously for days at a time.
notableQuotes.author: Matt Garman

notableQuotes.quote: Since its release in August, AGENTS.md has been adopted by more than 60,000 open-source projects and agent frameworks including Cursor, Devin, Gemini CLI, GitHub Copilot, and Jules.
notableQuotes.author: Linux Foundation

prompt: Daily AI news digest for December 14, 2025. Hero: Linux Foundation launches Agentic AI Foundation with OpenAI, Anthropic, and Block donating MCP, Goose, and AGENTS.md - the most significant standardization effort in AI agent history. Top stories: GitHub Copilot model picker (Claude Opus 4.5, Claude Sonnet 4.5, GPT-5.1-Codex-Max), Amazon's Kiro autonomous coding agent that works for days, Chrome DevTools MCP server trending, Theo's Claude Code review. Fresh repos: CopilotKit, Dify, SimStudio, Chrome DevTools MCP. New skills from SkillsMP: multi-ai-code-review, jules-api delegation, ai-report-export, skill-creator-plus. MCP servers: arxiv, kubectl, apify, gmail. Notable hooks: GitButler auto-branch, session env variables, desktop notifications. TUI tools: gum, gitui, slides, bottom. Tool updates: Claude Code 2.0.69, Gemini CLI 0.21.0-nightly, Codex 0.72.0.
